themes: Discomfort with public grant vetting panels
Transparency versus respect in grant evaluation
Tax policy as a tool for cultural support
key_phrases: public vetting of arts grants is...an uncomfortable arrangement
I'm all for transparency, but the idea of a public panel shitting all over applicants is unseemly
additional sales tax affixed to ticket prices for seats over $100
used to fund additional low to no cost arts programming
increase in the hotel occupancy tax
additional measure of property tax assigned to properties worth more than $750,000
barriers_identified: Uncomfortable and potentially disrespectful public grant evaluation process
solutions_proposed: Reform public vetting of arts grants to be less uncomfortable/unseemly
Implement additional sales tax on high-priced event tickets to fund arts programming
Increase hotel occupancy tax for arts funding
Add parking taxes (private lot and valet) to support arts
Assign additional property tax to high-value properties to fund arts and culture
